item.title: Report X-2025030992
item.description:
Report X-2025030992

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: MANVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2025030992 During a FRA Hazmat inspection the inspector heard hissing coming from the vacuum relief device on tank car FURX130415. The inspector notified the RR of it and a contractor was dispatched to investigate. They determined the car was under pressure and was venting through the Vacuum relief valve. They were able to stop it by removing the valve and installing a plug. X-2025030993 During FRA Hazmat inspection the inspector heard possible hissing from the vacuum relief valve on tank car FURX130488. Inspector notified the RR and contractor determined car had pressure on it and it was coming out of the valve. Contractor replaced the VRV with a steel plug.

item.title: Report X-2025030625
item.description:
Report X-2025030625

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 6th nine packages were found during the PM sort that had signs of leakage. The package was marked as UN1993, Flammable Liquid(Isopropanol), 3, II. The package was placed into a salvage drum and an amended shippers dec was requested from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2025030624
item.description:
Report X-2025030624

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: BELLMAWR
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 6th a package was discovered during the PM sort that had an odor and a slight noise could be heard. The package was opened and the cylinder inside appeared to be venting the gas that was inside of it. The package was marked as UN1011, BUTANE, 2.1. The package was isolated in a ventilated area and the consignee was contacted who decided to pick up the package.
